etymology.description: Depicts an eye stabbed by a needle, symbolizing oppression of the people -> people
etymology.interpretation: The character 民(民) (mín, 'people') originally depicted an eye being pierced by a tool, a metaphor for the suffering and experiences of the common people. This imagery evolved to represent the broader concept of the populace.

examples.chinese: 勤劳的民(勤勞的民)，构成国家的支柱(構成國家的支柱)。
examples.pinyin: Qínláo de mín, gòuchéng guójiā de zhīzhù.
examples.english: Hardworking people form the backbone of the nation.

examples.chinese: 民是国家不可忽视的力量(民是國家不可忽視的力量)。
examples.pinyin: Mín shì guójiā bùkě hūshì de lìliàng.
examples.english: The people are an indispensable force in the country.

examples.chinese: 民聚沙成塔(民聚沙成塔)。
examples.english: People can achieve great feats through unity.
